intro: Galium pseudoasprellum var. densiflorum, commonly known as the dense-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
